data.title: Intent Guides

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.11.2
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Turn intent guides on 
2. Use any language that doesn't use any type of brackets (say Python)

![capture](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/26769888/25418034/49f1780a-2a66-11e7-8c9c-cd47a6415d65.PNG)

What to see: The intent guide goes all the way down till it doesn't matches the same indentation rather than limiting itself at the function definition in the picture.

Sublime Text executes it right, but VS code doesn't. Moreover there is no option of active intent guides. These both seem to be obvious features for a good editor like VS Code, right?

data.title: Issue 15613 all files committed
data.body: This PR addresses issue #15613. This adds a git setting which determines whether or not to prompt the user if there are changes in the working tree and none of them are staged.

data.title: Typescript suggestion for object members and keyof not being shown
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.12-insiders
- OS Version: Windows 10 x64
- TS version: 2.3.0-dev.20170425

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Take the example below 

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/461084/25416594/f5f05c54-2a14-11e7-950b-0c14a603f049.png)

The problem tab is showing the proper values for that parameter, but it's not in the suggestions list. and weird enough, it's getting even text from node_modules typings but not for the string

I already have 

```
    "editor.quickSuggestions": {
      "other": true,
      "comments": false,
      "strings": true
    }
    "editor.wordBasedSuggestions": false
```

the same issue happens with "deep" objects, like when using [sift.js typings](https://github.com/crcn/sift.js/blob/master/index.d.ts) like so: 

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/461084/25416738/cf73beda-2a15-11e7-8246-5a3c7693f7e6.png)

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/461084/25416747/d8c61e38-2a15-11e7-962a-eaf27ebdd56e.png)

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/461084/25416827/59178748-2a16-11e7-81b3-08d34a40113e.png)
(here it should be showing either the members of the array of objects there `'state' | '$eq' | '$ne'` etc)

but after writing a improper field name, it shows an error
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/461084/25416883/a8ee6296-2a16-11e7-984a-a703053895ba.png)

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/461084/25417639/e6306104-2a1b-11e7-800a-49065dff17d2.png)


but I guess it's a problem with TS 2.3 dev itself, not with VSCode. it clearly says it's "boolean" in the docs, but it's accepting a string without complaining (even with `strict: true`)

data.title: Cannot build VSCode from source in port blocked proxy
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: master branch ( 7516e313064c9adfe7fc41dc3967d84655e3c181 )
- OS Version: Raspbian

Steps to Reproduce:

I have run following step under my company proxy environment, which blocks most port number, also git protocol.

1. Clone vscode from GitHub
2. Install npm
3. Run following commands
```bash
$ cd vscode && npm install -g mocha gulp
$ ./scripts/npm.sh install --arch=armhf
```
4. Error in git clone phase
```bash
pi@raspberrypi:~/vscode $ ./scripts/npm.sh install --arch=armhf
npm ERR! git clone --template=/home/pi/.electron-gyp/.npm/_git-remotes/_templates --mirror git://github.com/jrieken/v8-profiler.git /home/pi/.electron-gyp/.npm/_git-remotes/git-github-com-jrieken-v8-profiler-git-bc0803a4d4b2150b8a1bbffa80270769007036c2-277eeebf: Cloning into bare repository '/home/pi/.electron-gyp/.npm/_git-remotes/git-github-com-jrieken-v8-profiler-git-bc0803a4d4b2150b8a1bbffa80270769007036c2-277eeebf'...
npm ERR! git clone --template=/home/pi/.electron-gyp/.npm/_git-remotes/_templates --mirror git://github.com/jrieken/v8-profiler.git /home/pi/.electron-gyp/.npm/_git-remotes/git-github-com-jrieken-v8-profiler-git-bc0803a4d4b2150b8a1bbffa80270769007036c2-277eeebf: fatal: unable to connect to github.com:
npm ERR! git clone --template=/home/pi/.electron-gyp/.npm/_git-remotes/_templates --mirror git://github.com/jrieken/v8-profiler.git /home/pi/.electron-gyp/.npm/_git-remotes/git-github-com-jrieken-v8-profiler-git-bc0803a4d4b2150b8a1bbffa80270769007036c2-277eeebf: github.com[0: 192.30.255.113]: errno=接続がタイムアウトしました
npm ERR! git clone --template=/home/pi/.electron-gyp/.npm/_git-remotes/_templates --mirror git://github.com/jrieken/v8-profiler.git /home/pi/.electron-gyp/.npm/_git-remotes/git-github-com-jrieken-v8-profiler-git-bc0803a4d4b2150b8a1bbffa80270769007036c2-277eeebf: github.com[1: 192.30.255.112]: errno=接続がタイムアウトしました
npm ERR! Linux 4.4.50-v7+
npm ERR! argv "/home/pi/.nodebrew/node/v7.9.0/bin/node" "/home/pi/.nodebrew/current/bin/npm" "install" "--arch=armhf"
npm ERR! node v7.9.0
npm ERR! npm  v4.2.0
npm ERR! code 128

npm ERR! Command failed: git clone --template=/home/pi/.electron-gyp/.npm/_git-remotes/_templates --mirror git://github.com/jrieken/v8-profiler.git /home/pi/.electron-gyp/.npm/_git-remotes/git-github-com-jrieken-v8-profiler-git-bc0803a4d4b2150b8a1bbffa80270769007036c2-277eeebf
npm ERR! Cloning into bare repository '/home/pi/.electron-gyp/.npm/_git-remotes/git-github-com-jrieken-v8-profiler-git-bc0803a4d4b2150b8a1bbffa80270769007036c2-277eeebf'...
npm ERR! fatal: unable to connect to github.com:
npm ERR! github.com[0: 192.30.255.113]: errno=接続がタイムアウトしました
npm ERR! github.com[1: 192.30.255.112]: errno=接続がタイムアウトしました
npm ERR! 
npm ERR! 
npm ERR! 
npm ERR! If you need help, you may report this error at:
npm ERR!     <https://github.com/npm/npm/issues>

npm ERR! Please include the following file with any support request:
npm ERR!     /home/pi/.electron-gyp/.npm/_logs/2017-04-26T02_16_20_620Z-debug.log
```

In `npm-shrinkwrap.json`, `v8-profiler` module is written with only git protocol.

data.title: "Encoding not recognized"
data.body:
- Open folder with git enabled
- Set `"files.encoding": "utf8bom"`
- Reload window
- See error in devtools console

```
[Extension Host] Error: Encoding not recognized: 'utf8bom' (searched as: 'utf8bom')
    at Object.getCodec (/Applications/Visual Studio Code - Insiders.app/Contents/Resources/app/extensions/git/node_modules/iconv-lite/lib/index.js:102:23)
    at Object.getDecoder (/Applications/Visual Studio Code - Insiders.app/Contents/Resources/app/extensions/git/node_modules/iconv-lite/lib/index.js:118:23)
    at Object.decode (/Applications/Visual Studio Code - Insiders.app/Contents/Resources/app/extensions/git/node_modules/iconv-lite/lib/index.js:36:25)
    at Socket.once (/Applications/Visual Studio Code - Insiders.app/Contents/Resources/app/extensions/git/out/git.js:126:59)
    at Object.onceWrapper (events.js:290:19)
    at emitOne (events.js:101:20)
    at Socket.emit (events.js:188:7)
    at Pipe._handle.close [as _onclose] (net.js:501:12)
```

- "utf8bom" is an encoding that we apparently support as it shows up in the intellisense for that setting. I thought that list came from encodings supported by iconv-lite. Not sure whether git is doing something different, or whether it doesn't work in the editor either. But, I had an issue filed about this encoding label not being supported by ripgrep so people are using it.

data.title: Test plan for Emmet features from extension using new APIs
data.body:
Test item for #21943

Complexity: 4

OS

- [x] macOS @joaomoreno 

**Pre-req for testing**

- Clone the repo for the extension https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode-emmet
- Run `vsce package` to get the vsix
- Side load the extension by `code-insiders --install-extension emmet-0.0.1.vsix`

**Suggestion Items**
- As you type an abbreviation, the suggestion list should show the expanded abbreviation. Can be turned off by disabling `emmet.suggestExpandedAbbreviation`
- As you type an abbreviation, all possible abbreviations should show in the suggestion list. Can be turned off by disabling `emmet.suggestAbbreviations`
- After typing an abbreviation, escape the suggestion list, hit TAB. The built-in emmet expansion should not work
- Set `emmet.suggestExpandedAbbreviation` to `false`, and repeat the previous step, built in emmet expansion should now work

**Commands to test:**
- _Emmet 2.0: Expand abbreviation_
        - The selected text or the text preceeding the cursor if no text is selected is taken as the abbreviation to expand.
        - Works with html, xml, jade, slim, haml files and css,scss,sass, less, stylus files
- _Emmet 2.0: Wrap with abbreviation_
        - The selected text or the current line if no text is selected, is wrapped with given abbreviation. 
        - Works with html, xml, jade, slim, haml files
- _Emmet 2.0: Remove Tag_
        - The tag under the cursor is removed along with the corresponding opening/closing tag. Works with multiple cursors. Works only in html and xml files.
- _Emmet 2.0: Update Tag_
        - The tag under the cursor is updated to the given tag. Works with multiple cursors. Works only in html and xml files.
- _Emmet 2.0: Go to Matching Pair_
        - Cursor moves to the tag matching to the tag under cursor. Works with multiple cursors. Works only in html and xml files.

data.title: Problem saving keybindings

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.11.2 and 1.12.0 - insiders
- OS Version: Windows 10

-- Sorry for the English, I used Google Translator --

When I set a shortcut, if you press <kbd>Ctrl</kbd> + <kbd>k</kbd>, the VSCode is waiting for a second combination. Which works great.


But if I press any keyboard and then <kbd>Ctrl</kbd> + <kbd>k</kbd>, this key takes the function of <kbd>Ctrl</kbd> + <kbd>K</kbd> and always waits for a second combination.

Example: <kbd>n</kbd> <kbd>Ctrl</kbd> + <kbd>k</kbd>

If you type a text and press <kbd>n</kbd> it is waiting for the second combination.

I know the same open multiple ports for shortcuts, but maybe one maybe a setting where I only limit use to <kbd>Ctrl</kbd> + <kbd>k</kbd> to receive a second combination.

My suggestion is (I do not know if it's possible):

1- Limit second combination only to <kbd>Ctrl</kbd> + <kbd>k</kbd>, or until the user changes.
2- Whenever you have this situation, reverse the shortcuts automatically, either on the new screen or manually. If you typed <kbd>n</kbd> <kbd>Ctrl</kbd> + <kbd>k</kbd> it should interpret or edit the file for <kbd>Ctrl</kbd> + <kbd>k</kbd> <kbd>n</kbd>
3 - Prevent saving the shortcut key if it is wrong or prevents it from working.

data.title: Install Icon is Pixilated in Installer Window
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.11.2
- OS Version: 16179

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Run installer

I noticed during install on two different machines that the VS Code Icon doesn't render nicely:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/24302614/25412460/b43c62d6-29d7-11e7-9caf-00f29fc3fba8.png)

It has visible pixilated aliasing around the edges, in the case above, it's not even consistent along the diagonal.  My other machine was similar, though not as bad.

I have my display scales at 125% and 150%, so that may have something to do with it.  It'd be nice if it was a higher resolution image from the get-go though, so that wouldn't matter.

data.title: Focus does not return to file tree.

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.12.0 - insiders
- OS Version: Windows 10

-- Sorry for the English, I used Google Translator --

Configure this in your keybindings file:

`{ "key": "escape", "command": "workbench.action.focusActiveEditorGroup", "when": "explorerViewletFocus" }`


Do these steps :
1- Have a project with two or more files open.
2- Click the blank area in the file tree.
3- The focus is on the whole area.
4- Press <kbd>Esc</kbd>.
5. Press <kbd>Ctrl</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>E</kbd> .
6- Focus goes to Open Editors.

Another situation:
1- Have a project with two or more files open.
2- Close the folder.
3- Open the project again.
4 - Press <kbd>Ctrl</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>E</kbd>.
5- Focus goes to Open Editors.

I searched and found "Focus on Open Editors" <kbd>Ctrl</kbd> + <kbd>k</kbd> <kbd>E</kbd>. That is, it does not make sense to me when I hit <kbd>Ctrl</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>E</kbd> in the above situations it points to Open Editors.

data.title: PR to add showParentInTab setting and functionality

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
This PR is a solution to Issue #12965 

Added a configuration option `showParentInTab` that when set to true (which is default) changes the tab display as follows when more than one tab is opened with same file name.

![pasted image at 2017_04_20 06_20 am](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/357219/25409547/686b4c06-29e0-11e7-8f9d-57d5ba9d9188.png)

This is my first PR for this code base, Comments are more than welcomed and if there is a more preferred way then please let me know.  Thanks.

data.title: Expand selection doesn't always work with every theme (for quotes)
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Type anything between quotes
2. Put cursor between the cursor on what you just typed and use expand selection (Alt+Shift+Right Arrow)
3. Try it first with Dark+ (default) theme or Dracula Theme and then with Mattia Astornio's Material Theme or with Nord theme

Thing to notice: If the quotes are colored as same as text, it includes it in the selection, but it doesn't if it has different color assigned. 

![ff2de466-29bb-11e7-9230-5e5ff7f0443d](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/26769888/25409665/81d88366-2a30-11e7-85ee-4011b1739ddf.gif)


To-do: Expand selection should not include quotes, but just the text because a lot of times we need to change what is inside the quotes only. Putting quotes around the text again will add one step more.

Originally posted on Dracula theme repo, but as it also includes the default Dark+ theme and seems to be like a bug in VS Code itself, which I found a lot of people like and stick to it, so I put it here too.

https://github.com/dracula/visual-studio-code/issues/24#issuecomment-297170876
(Below one is copied from the link above)
Scopes of interest:
* punctuation.definition.string.begin
* punctuation.definition.string.end
When set to a different color than string, it expands correctly. When set to the same color, it does not.

data.title: Markdown headings are treated as modules and properties simultaneously
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.11.2

It looks like markdown heading symbols are modules and properties at the same time. So while using _Go to Symbols_ menu, heading navigation turns into mess:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3600063/25408376/6f7a4b4c-2a16-11e7-835d-cad15eac1bb3.png)

Sorting symbols with the `:` command helps a little but still annoying: a) it requires extra key pressing, b) modules are shown at the first place, so it needs to scroll to see headings indentation, c) headings indentation works only as a workaround — there is no real indentation, only by redundant hash signs in properties names.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3600063/25408386/74699798-2a16-11e7-8641-f3cce4d17c63.png)

data.title: Feature Request: Doc Block Annotations (vscode / Typescript)
data.body: - VSCode Version: all - OS Version: all Something like this: ```TS /** * The long description... * Second line etc... * * @deprecated * @default 10 * @example 125 */ let val: number ``` Become this in the vscode autocompletion: It would be great if some of them get supported and displayed in a logical position. The autocompletion of vscode is the best outside for the web but unfortunately slightly naked.

data.title: Test IME
data.body:
Complexity: 4

* [x] macOS VS Code - @weinand
* [x] Windows VS Code - @bpasero
* [x] Linux VS Code @Tyriar
* [x] Windows IE/Edge - @alexandrudima

We introduced Chromium m56 this iteration and it had several CJK IME bugs
* https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/24557 
* https://github.com/Microsoft/monaco-editor/issues/339
* https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/24861
* https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/25023

Please make sure all above issues no longer exist and please follow our IME Test wiki https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/wiki/IME-Test if you don't have experience with that.

data.title: Test Drag and drop enhancement
data.body:
Test https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/23995 , https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/24547, https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/24616, https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/24553

Complexity: 2
* [x] macOS - @isidorn
* [x] Linux - @Tyriar 
* [x] Windows - @dbaeumer

Please test 

* DND with copy to any character on Windows doesn't trigger `Go to definition` or other commands.
* Mouse pointer style changes whenever you press modifier key (Ctrl/Option).
* Mouse pointer style doesn't change when DND is disabled.
* We now use Ctrl key on Linux as well.

data.title: Update TS/JS Grammars
data.body: Pick up latest JS/TS Grammar
